title.narrative: Promoting Rural Income thru Support in Agriculture

description.narrative:
Promoting Rural Income thru Support in Agriculture (PRISMA-2) is the second phase of the successful Australia Indonesia Partnership for Rural Economic Development (AIP-Rural) program (2013-2018). PRISMA-2 aims to increase the incomes of an additional 700,000 smallholder farming households by 30% by December 2023 in the six provinces of Papua, West Papua, West Nusa Tenggara, East Nusa Tenggara, East Java, and Central Java. At least 60% of the beneficiaries will consist of farmers living below USD2.5 per day at PPP (Purchasing Power Parity).
PRISMA-2 will continue to use the market systems development approach in the areas of agriculture, horticulture, livestock, and aquaculture sectors to stimulate systemic market change and improve smallholder farmer competitiveness through access to new markets, better inputs, know-how and technology. A total of 1 million smallholder farming households will benefit as a result of Australia’s 10 year investment in the AIP-Rural and PRISMA-2.
